pageContext.description: Much broken.  Very fragile + attached to a card on which is a sketch of its supposed outline
pageContext.other: Apologies for any mis-transcription of Welch
pageContext.associations: found in a barrow with a skeleton
pageContext.publications: Archaeologia Cambrensis 2nd Ser. ii (1851) 9., Royal Commission on Ancient Monuments in Wales + Mounanthshire [?].  Inventory of the County of Denbigh. P. 58, No 186.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection, Dr. Sprigg, Ruthin Castle, N. Wales, 1926
pageContext.site: Wales, Clyn Traian, Orsedd Wen, found with a skeleton in a Barrow, March 1850
pageContext.remarks: Label: (1) “ Ruthin Castle, (2) “ Part of a spearhead or dagger (Ancient British) found with a skeleton in a tumulus at Brsedd Wen, near Selattyer in March 1850: the outline is filled up from a spear of similar type found at Ebuall, near Oswestry in 1848 or 1849.
